subject: p17270742
History: Year old man with known history of cavitary aspergillosis, now presents with productive cough and fever.
Findings: Again seen are two cavitary lesions in the right lung, with the largest in the right perihilar region, now measuring at least 14 cm in craniocaudal. This lesion is slightly larger since the prior study where it measured 11 cm. An airfluid level is seen in this lesion. The smaller cavitary lesion in the right upper lobe is stable. No new cavitary lesion is seen. Multiple areas of ground glass opacities, with more confluent consolidation in the left upper lobe are similar to the prior CT. No pleural effusions or pneumothorax is seen.
Impression: Cavitary lesions in the right lung, consistent with known aspergillosis, with interval increase in the size of the largest lesion since. Stable multifocal ground glass opacities, with more confluent consolidation in the left upper lobe.
